citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
**During a review of records the following was noted:
Protocol #203-018:
***Changes regarding the use of animals, swine, was not approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee
(IACUC). Section M02 indicates the protocol was approved for the use of pigs weighing between 45-60 kg. The Yorkshire
pig #P1351 used on this protocol was received on 6/01/2023 weighing 33.7kg. The principal investigator postponed the
procedure several times resulting in the procedure taking place on 8/10/2023. The weight of the pig at the time of the
procedure was 78.8 kg. The anesthesia machine used for the animal during the procedure had a maximum weight
capacity of 68 kg. The staff conveyed that the weight of the animal at the time of the procedure lead to inadequate
intubation during the procedure resulting in insufficient anesthesia and ventilation leading to the death of the animal,
according to facility records.
***Section A01 indicated blood would be collected via jugular vein, however, the incident report noted blood had also
been collected via cranial vena cava at the request of the principal investigator which was not approved by the IACUC.
Correct by October 20, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
Kristin Ray, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
